description: OPINION AND ORDER: I order as follows: 1. I DENY on the merits Amended Petition [314) Claims l(A)(l), l(A)(2)(e)-(g),l(A)(3), l(A)(4), l(B)(l), l(C)(2)(a)-(d), l(D)(3)(a)-(g), l(D)(4), l(E)(5); Claim 2;Claims 3(A)(l), 3(A)(2), 3(D)(l), 3(D)(4)(a)-(f), 3(D)(5); Claims 4(A), 4(B)(l)(a)(c), 4(c); Claims 6(A)(l), 6(A)(2); Claims 7(A)(l)-(6), 7(B); Claim 8; Claim 9;Claims lO(A)-(D); Claims 1l(A),1 l(C)-(E); Claims 12(1)-(12); Claims 13(4)-(10);Claims 14(A)(l)-(3), 14(B)(l)-(3), 14(C)-(E); Claims 15(A)(l)-(5), 15(B)-(E);Claims 16(1)-(6), 16(7)(a)-(e), 16(8) & (9); Claim 20 and Claim 21; 2. I DENY Claims 18 and 19 without prejudice as premature;3. Respondent shall file, within sixty (60) days of the date of this Opinion and Order, a brief addressing the exhaustion, procedural default and any exceptions toprocedural defaultpe1iainingto Claims l(A)(2)(a)-( d), l(A)(5)(a)-( d), 1 (B)(2)(a)-( e ),l(C)(l), l(C)(3)(a)-(d), l(C)(4), l(D)(l)(a)-(d), l(D)(2), l(E)(l)(a)-(k), l(E)(2)(a) & (b ), 1 (E)(3), l(E)( 4), l(E)(6), 1 (F)(l)(a)-(c); Claims 3(A)(3)(a)-(r), 3(B)(l )(a)-(z),3(C)(l)(a)-(m), 3(D)(2), 3(D)(3)(a)-(c), 3(D)(6); Claim 5; Claims 6(B)-(E); Claim lO(E); Claim 1 l(B); Claims 13(1)-(3); Claim 16(7)(f); and Claim 17. Petitioner shall file a response within 60 days of the filing of respondent's brief. Respondent shall file a reply within 30 days of the filing of petitioner's response and petitioner shall file a sur-reply, if any, within 30 days of the filing of respondent's reply; and 4. Due to the subsequent filing of the Amended Petition, I DENY as moot Motion 299 . I will resolve the issues of procedural default, exhaustion andexceptions to procedural default pertaining to the remaining Amended Petition claims as necessary in my examination and resolution of these claims after a final round ofbriefing from the parties. (See 138 page opinion for more information) Signed on 8/9/18 by Judge Robert E. Jones. (dsg) (Entered: 08/13/2018)

description: VACATED PURSUANT TO THE USCA FOR THE FEDERAL CIRCUIT'S OPINION AND ORDER ENTERED AT ECF 646. OPINION AND ORDER. The Court FINDS the 856 Patent, the 176 Patent, the 193 Patent, and the 806 Patent claims valid and literally INFRINGED and the 205 Patent NOT INFRINGED. The Court FINDS the actual damages suffered by Centripetal as a result of infringement total $755,808,545; that the infringement was willful and egregious and shall be enhanced by a factor of 2.5x to equal $1,889,521,362.50. The Court awards pre-judgment interest of $13,717,925 applied to the actual damages before enhancement plus its costs. This, accordingly, equals a total award of $1,903,239,287.50 payable in a lump sum due on the judgment date. The Court, additionally, imposes a running royalty of 10% on the apportioned sales of the accused products and their successors for a period of three years, followed by a second three-year term with a running royalty of 5% on said sales upon the terms described supra. It DENIES any further relief to Centripetal at the termination of the second three-year term. Signed by District Judge Henry C. Morgan, Jr., on 10/5/20. (bpet) Modified text on 10/19/2022 (afar). (Entered: 10/05/2020)
